item.title: Animosity between Sam Konstas and Virat Kohli? Australia wicket-keeper answers - The Times of India
item.description:
Alex Carey Addresses Rumors of Animosity Between Sam Konstas and Virat Kohli

Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

In a press conference, Australia wicketkeeper-batter Alex Carey denied any animosity between Sam Konstas and Virat Kohli after a physical incident during the Boxing Day Test.

  • Carey addressed the recent rumors about a supposed confrontation between Konstas and Kohli.
  • He noted that both players exhibited sportsmanship by shaking hands after the incident.
  • Carey praised Sam Konstas for his impressive debut, scoring a daring half-century against India.
  • Konstas' performance is seen as a fresh approach in the aggressive Australian batting style.
  • Carey emphasized that while Konstas brought a new energy, it is not sustainable to expect explosive performances in every match.
"Not that I'm aware of... I think I saw a photo of them shaking hands and a little tap on the back. It's Test cricket." - Alex Carey

In conclusion, Carey reassured that the competitive nature of Test cricket often leads to intense moments but did not expect any lingering issues between the players.

item.title: Will Mitchell Starc play or miss Sydney Test? Australia wicket-keeper answers - The Times of India
item.description:
Will Mitchell Starc play or miss Sydney Test? Australia wicket-keeper answers

Date: Undisclosed Source: Times of India

The Australian wicketkeeper-batter Alex Carey states that Mitchell Starc is likely to play in the upcoming Test despite dealing with a rib injury. Starc has displayed resilience during previous matches, but his fitness remains a concern for the team.

  • Mitchell Starc is managing discomfort from a rib injury.
  • Wicketkeeper Alex Carey expects him to push through for the final Test.
  • Starc's fitness will be assessed closer to the Test date.
  • Australia needs to win or draw the match to secure the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • If Starc is unfit, Jhye Richardson may be called up as a replacement.
"He'll be fine. He will push through," - Alex Carey

The decision on Starc's participation is pending, but there's confidence in his ability to play despite his injuries.

item.description:
IND vs AUS: Without Jasprit Bumrah, the series might have been more one-sided, says Glenn McGrath

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Not specified

Former Australian cricketer Glenn McGrath expressed that the absence of Jasprit Bumrah could have resulted in a more lopsided test series between India and Australia.

  • Discussion on Bumrah's impact on the Indian bowling lineup.
  • Comparative performance of the Australian team in the series.
  • Insights into how Bumrah's skills could have changed match outcomes.
"Bumrah's absence is felt, and it has made a significant difference in the series competitiveness."

McGrath's remarks underline the crucial role of key players in international cricket and their influence on series dynamics.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir Wanted Cheteshwar Pujara For Australia Tour, Stunning Selection Details Emerge - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Wanted Cheteshwar Pujara For Australia Tour, Stunning Selection Details Emerge

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

Team India head coach Gautam Gambhir is at odds with the BCCI regarding team selection. Reports indicate Gambhir is frustrated with the team's performance and has advocated for the return of Test specialist Cheteshwar Pujara for the Australian tour.

  • Gambhir has faced challenges with team selection decisions made by the BCCI.
  • Despite India's victory in the Perth Test, Gambhir pushed for Pujara's inclusion.
  • Pujara, who has an average of 43.60 in 103 Test matches, hasn't played since the WTC final in 2023.
  • Gambhir's tenure has faced criticism regarding player performance and on-field execution.
Pujara is a veteran of 103 Test matches at an average of 43.60, and he played a key role in India's previous two series victories in Australia.

Gambhir's plea for Pujara reveals tensions in team dynamics and strategy as India navigates the Australia series.

item.description:
What a way to wrap up 2024: Viswanathan Anand congratulates Vaishali on clinching bronze in World Blitz Championship

Publication Date: October 2024
Source: Times of India

This article celebrates Vaishali's achievement in securing a bronze medal at the World Blitz Championship, a remarkable accomplishment in the chess world.

  • Vaishali clinched a bronze medal in the World Blitz Championship.
  • Viswanathan Anand publicly congratulated Vaishali for her achievement.
  • The championship highlights the growing recognition of female chess players in competitive events.
"What a way to wrap up 2024!" - Viswanathan Anand on Vaishali's achievement.

This achievement marks a significant milestone in Vaishali's chess career and inspires many aspiring chess players.

item.title: 'What a way to wrap up 2024': Viswanathan Anand congratulates Vaishali on clinching bronze in World Blitz Championship - The Times of India
item.description:
What a way to wrap up 2024: Viswanathan Anand congratulates Vaishali on clinching bronze in World Blitz Championship

Date: December 2024 Source: Times of India

Indian chess master Viswanathan Anand celebrated his sister Vaishali's remarkable achievement of winning a bronze medal at the World Blitz Championship held in 2024.

  • Vaishali's victory adds to India's reputation in the chess world.
  • Anand praised her hard work and dedication in the game.
  • The championship showcased top talents from around the globe.
“She has put in a tremendous amount of effort, and I am really proud of her.” - Viswanathan Anand

This accomplishment not only highlights Vaishali’s skills but also the growing prominence of Indian chess on the international stage.

item.title: BBL 2024-2025: Match 18, HUR vs SIX Match Prediction – Who will win today’s BBL match between HUR vs SIX? - CricTracker
item.description:
BBL 2024-2025: Match 18, HUR vs SIX Match Prediction

Date: January 1, 2025

Source: CricTracker

The Sydney Sixers are set to face the Hobart Hurricanes in Match 18 of the Big Bash League 2024-25. The Sixers have been in great form with four consecutive wins, while the Hurricanes have two wins out of three matches.

  • The match will take place at Bellerive Oval, Hobart, starting at 10:30 am IST.
  • Sydney Sixers won their last match convincingly against Brisbane Heat.
  • Hobart Hurricanes managed a win against Adelaide Strikers in their last outing.
  • Pitch conditions at Bellerive Oval are expected to be favorable for both batters and bowlers.
“Sydney Sixers to win the match.”

This prediction considers both teams' performances leading up to the match.

item.title: Criticising South Africa for WTC Final qualification isn’t fair: Kevin Pietersen - The Times of India
item.description:
Criticising South Africa for WTC Final qualification isn’t fair: Kevin Pietersen

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

In a recent statement, Kevin Pietersen defended South Africa's qualification for the World Test Championship Final, arguing that criticism of their entry is unjustified.

  • Pietersen highlighted the competitive nature of international cricket that allows teams to qualify based on performance.
  • He emphasized the importance of recognizing South Africa's achievements without bias.
  • The discussion comes in light of debates on the credibility of teams qualifying for major tournaments.
"Criticism should be constructive, not damaging. South Africa has earned its spot through hard work and dedication," remarked Pietersen.

In conclusion, Pietersen's comments urge cricket fans and analysts to appreciate the game's competitive landscape rather than indulge in hollow critiques.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir, Rohit Sharma To Be Grilled By BCCI. R Ashwin's Shock Retirement A Big Topic: Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
BCCI to Question Rohit Sharma and Gautam Gambhir Amidst Cricketing Controversies

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team is facing scrutiny from the BCCI following a disappointing series that jeopardized World Test Championship qualification. Rohit Sharma's retirement speculation and Gautam Gambhir's decisions as coach are under review as discussions are expected post the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • India's cricket team experienced a string of poor performances, affecting their World Test Championship prospects.
  • Gautam Gambhir and Rohit Sharma are expected to face tough questioning from BCCI management.
  • Rohit Sharma has had a significant dip in performance, averaging less than 11 runs in his last 15 Test innings.
  • There are rumors regarding Rohit Sharma's possible retirement from Test cricket.
  • Gambhir's coaching choices, especially regarding player selections, are being evaluated.
  • Ravichandran Ashwin's abrupt retirement is also a matter of concern, although Gambhir reportedly had no role in this decision.
"If I was a selector now... I'd be saying, 'Rohit, thank you for your service. You've been a great player, but we're going to bring in Jasprit Bumrah as captain for the SCG.'" - Mark Waugh

As the cricketing world watches closely, both Rohit and Gambhir must navigate this critical juncture in their careers, with long-term implications for the team at stake.

item.title: Amid Pressure On Gautam Gambhir, Two-Time World Cup Winner Says No To India Coach Job Prospect - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Amid Pressure On Gautam Gambhir, Two-Time World Cup Winner Says No To India Coach Job Prospect

Publication Date: November 15, 2024
Source: NDTV

Former Australian coach discusses the future of Indian cricket as icons Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli contemplate retirement.

  • Yashasvi Jaiswal impresses with scores of 161, 82, and 84 in ongoing series.
  • Darren Lehmann praises Jasprit Bumrah, considering him an all-time great.
  • Lehmann believes Indian cricket has depth with emerging young talent.
  • He declines interest in coaching the Indian national team, focusing on developing young players instead.
"It would have been an honour to work with Indian national team but I am done with international cricket. I just want the young guys to get better." - Darren Lehmann

Overall, the future of Indian cricket looks bright with young talents emerging, even as senior players face potential retirement.

item.title: Top 10 cricketers of 2024: From run-machines Joe Root and Yashasvi Jaiswal to standout bowler Jasprit Bum - The Times of India
item.description:
Top 10 Cricketers of 2024

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Sports News Daily

This article features the top cricketers of 2024, focusing on remarkable performances and stats from athletes like Joe Root, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and standout bowler Jasprit Bumrah.

  • Joe Root continues to dominate as a run-machine.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal's emerging talent captures attention this year.
  • Jasprit Bumrah excels with his bowling prowess, making significant contributions to his team.
“The performance of these players showcases the evolution of cricket in the modern era.”

The highlighted cricketers exemplify excellence in their respective roles and are shaping the future of the sport.

item.title: End of the line for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma? - The Times of India
item.description:
End of the line for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma?

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Times of India

In Indian cricket, retirement discussions are stirring as both Kohli and Rohit face pressure ahead of their final outing, potentially influencing their places on the team.

  • Both players are experiencing a decline in form.
  • Rohit Sharma may face retirement if India fails to reach the World Test Championship final.
  • Virat Kohli's performances still show patches of brilliance despite a gradual decline.
  • The Indian selection committee struggles with tough decisions regarding star players.
  • The upcoming Test in Sydney may be crucial for both players' futures.
“With Kohli, the numbers make for equally dreary reading - he averages 24.52 this year - but he is at a superior level compared to Rohit as a Test batsman.”

The combinations of form, age, and potential retirement make the upcoming match pivotal for both Kohli and Rohit, possibly determining the future of Indian cricket's star players.

item.title: Can cricket shrink to save itself? - The Cricket Monthly
item.description:
Can Cricket Shrink to Save Itself?

Publication Date: 2024

Source: ESPNcricinfo

Test cricket is experiencing growth despite its challenges, including a congested calendar. A recent gathering of cricket leaders discussed the sport's state, revealing governance issues and the need for reforms.

  • 2024 saw 54 Tests, with high-profile matches like New Zealand's 3-0 victory over India.
  • The format has expanded globally, but financial dependency on a single market (India) poses governance challenges.
  • Players face conflicts between league commitments and national board obligations.
  • Test cricket had an exceptional year with dramatic results and high competitiveness.
  • Discussions at World Cricket Connects indicated a necessity for change amidst cricket's governance issues.
"Cricket is broken, and indeed ungovernable;... the self-interest of members will always trump the wider welfare of the game." - Greg Barclay

Despite challenges, cricket continues to evolve and find new audiences. The future may involve fewer matches but richer narratives that resonate with fans.

item.title: It's sunny days for Test cricket, but is there too much of it? - The Cricket Monthly
item.description:
It's sunny days for Test cricket, but is there too much of it?

Publication Date: 2024, Source: ESPNcricinfo

The article reflects on the extraordinary year for Test cricket in 2024, discussing the potential scheduling solutions and the challenges faced by the sport.

  • 2024 saw 54 Tests, marking the joint second-most this century.
  • Test cricket experienced an unprecedented high in quality, with only two draws all year.
  • Cricket's governance issues were highlighted, particularly the influence of the BCCI on global cricket.
  • Despite tensions in scheduling, Test cricket has shown remarkable resilience and popularity.
  • New Zealand's historic 3-0 victory over India became one of the biggest headlines of the year.
“It's a mess and we know it: former ICC chair Greg Barclay admitted in 2024 that cricket is ungovernable, given the way its administration is structured.”

The future of Test cricket relies on balancing tradition with modern demands, ensuring schedules foster meaningful competition.

item.title: Watch: Holding Hands Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma Spotted In Sydney Going To New Year Party - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Watch: Holding Hands Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma Spotted In Sydney Going To New Year Party

Date: January 1, 2025 Source: NDTV

Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were seen in Sydney celebrating the arrival of the New Year along with fellow cricket player Devdutt Padikkal.

  • The couple was spotted on the streets of Sydney on December 31, 2024.
  • They were reportedly heading to a New Year party.
  • There has been significant discussion surrounding Kohli and Sharma's presence in Sydney amid ongoing cricket discussions relating to their performances.
“I must say there is no comparison between Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli as Test batters.” – Sanjay Manjrekar

The couple's sighting generated excitement among fans, highlighting their popularity on social media platforms.

item.title: Retirement Hint? Australia Great Highlights Rohit Sharma's "Unusual" Act, Says This On Virat Kohli - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Retirement Hint? Australia Great Highlights Rohit Sharma's 'Unusual' Act, Says This On Virat Kohli

Publication Date: December 31, 2024

Source: NDTV

The discussions surrounding India captain Rohit Sharma's potential retirement from Test cricket have intensified following a significant loss to Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • Rohit Sharma's performance and emotional state during the recent Test match raise questions about his future in the longest format of the game.
  • Justin Langer observed Rohit displaying unusual emotions on the field, suggesting that he may be considering retirement.
  • Langer noted the stress Rohit faces as captain when team performance falters and personal runs are lacking.
  • Contrastingly, Langer believes Virat Kohli still has years of top-level cricket ahead of him.
  • Both Langer and Ravi Shastri agree that this could be the end of Rohit's Test career but see a different trajectory for Kohli.
"Rohit Sharma looks very tired to me. I saw him quite emotional on the field yesterday. That's unusual for us to see Rohit like that." - Justin Langer

In conclusion, the ongoing discussions indicate a pivotal moment for Rohit Sharma as he contemplates his career while Virat Kohli seems to have more time left in international cricket.

item.title: Sushila Meena: How Sachin Tendulkar made this Indian girl an online cricket star - BBC.com
item.description:
Sushila Meena: How Sachin Tendulkar made this Indian girl an online cricket star

Date: October 2023

Source: BBC Hindi

10-year-old Sushila Meena's life changed drastically after cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar shared a video of her bowling, leading to widespread recognition and media attention.

  • Sushila, from a poor tribal family in Rajasthan, didn't recognize Tendulkar but expressed gratitude for his support.
  • Her bowling ability has captured the attention of many, including politicians and social activists.
  • Despite her newfound fame, Sushila faces challenges and skepticism regarding her cricket participation in a traditional society.
  • The school where she studies encourages cricket, but lacks resources for higher education.
"I don't know who he [Sachin Tendulkar] is," Sushila notes about her cricketing idol.

Overall, Sushila's story reflects the impact of social media on local talents, but also highlights the need for better support and opportunities for young athletes in rural areas.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir wanted Cheteshwar Pujara in BGT squad, was turned down by selectors - The Indian Express
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir wanted Cheteshwar Pujara in BGT squad, was turned down by selectors

Publication Date: December 12, 2024

Source: The Indian Express

With the Indian team struggling after a loss in the Border Gavaskar Trophy, coach Gautam Gambhir proposed including veteran batter Cheteshwar Pujara, but selectors rejected the idea.

  • India's performance has been subpar, especially in the ongoing series against Australia.
  • Pujara has been out of the national team since the 2023 World Test Championship final.
  • Gambhir has expressed frustration over the team's recent performances.
  • Pujara is recognized for his strong past performances in Australia, leading the run charts in previous series.
  • Opposing players acknowledge his abilities and contributions to the game.
“I am happy that Cheteshwar Pujara is not here. He is someone who bats time and spends a lot of time at the crease and makes you earn his wicket every time.” - Josh Hazlewood

The rejection of Gambhir's suggestion leaves questions about the team's strategy moving forward, especially given the history and skill Pujara brings to the field.

item.title: EXPRESS EXCLUSIVE: Gautam Gambhir cracks whip on Team India’s chaotic dressing room: ‘Bahut ho gaya’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
EXPRESS EXCLUSIVE: Gautam Gambhir cracks whip on Team India’s chaotic dressing room: ‘Bahut ho gaya’

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Indian Express

Gautam Gambhir expressed frustration with Team India's performance and individualistic approaches after a significant defeat to Australia. He has emphasized the need for players to align with team strategies moving forward.

  • Gambhir delivered a stern message to the squad following a poor performance in the Melbourne Test.
  • He criticized players for deviating from team strategies in favor of personal playstyles.
  • Gambhir is taking a firmer approach, threatening players who don't adhere to planned strategies with exclusion from the team.
  • The atmosphere in the dressing room has been described as tense and chaotic.
  • There are rising ambitions within the team contributing to a lack of cohesion.
“Bahut ho gaya,” Gambhir reportedly stated, emphasizing his dissatisfaction with current performances.

The situation highlights a transitional phase in Team India, necessitating a balance between individual expression and a unified team strategy.

item.title: Indian team’s Test captaincy: Senior cricketer throws his hat in ring, projects himself as ‘interim captain’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Senior Cricketer Emerges as Interim Captain Candidate Amid Rohit Sharma Scrutiny

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: The Indian Express

As Rohit Sharma faces criticism for his form and captaincy during the Border Gavaskar Trophy, a senior player is positioning himself as a potential interim captain amid evident tensions within the team.

  • Rohit Sharma's leadership has come under fire due to poor performance in recent matches.
  • Reports suggest team dynamics are strained, with coach Gautam Gambhir expressing dissatisfaction with players’ performances.
  • A senior player is vying for the captaincy, presenting himself as 'Mr. Fix-It' in a chaotic dressing room.
  • Rohit has struggled with scores like 3, 6, 10, 3, and 9 in five innings against Australia.
  • Former player Irfan Pathan comments on Rohit's struggles, implying his captaincy is preserving his spot on the team.
“A player who has made about 20,000 runs — yet the way Rohit is struggling now, it seems his form is not supporting him at all.” - Irfan Pathan

With ongoing issues in the team and underwhelming individual performances, the immediate future for Rohit Sharma remains uncertain as discussions arise about leadership changes.

item.title: Vinesh Phogat stripped of Olympic medal; Khelif gender row; BCCI vs PCB: 10 controversies of world sports in 2024 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Top 10 Controversies in World Sports of 2024

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The year 2024 has seen significant controversies across various sports, igniting debates and discussions globally. The incidents highlighted not only challenges in sports integrity but also the socio-political implications within the sporting arena.

  • 1. Vinesh Phogat's Olympics Disqualification: The Indian wrestler was disqualified from the Paris 2024 Olympics just hours before her final due to being overweight.
  • 2. Imane Khelif Gender Row: Algerian boxer Khelif faced gender eligibility controversies after her gold medal win amidst heated discussions over gender policies.
  • 3. PCB vs BCCI for Champions Trophy 2025: Clash over hosting rights due to political tensions raised questions about cricket governance.
  • 4. Sanjiv Goenka and KL Rahul Spat in IPL 2024: A public dispute raised debates about management practices in cricket franchises.
  • 5. Magnus Carlsen Disqualified from World Rapid and Blitz: The chess legend faced dress code violations during a crucial tournament.
  • 6. Real Madrid Boycotts Ballon d'Or: The club protested against perceived biases in award voting.
  • 7. Jannik Sinner Doping Violations: The tennis star faced doping allegations amid a complex investigation process.
  • 8. Igor Stimac and AIFF tussle: The coach of India's men’s football team had a dramatic exit leading to contractual disputes.
  • 9. Protests Against FIFA for 2034 World Cup Allocation: FIFA's decision attracted backlash due to Saudi Arabia's human rights record.
  • 10. Formula 1 Budget Cap Violations: Multiple teams faced serious penalties for breaching financial regulations.
“The integrity of sports is under threat as controversies continue to surface.”

2024 has proven to be a pivotal year, with these controversies reflecting the growing complexities and challenges that are reshaping the landscape of sports while prompting necessary dialogues about governance, fairness, and integrity within the field.

item.title: ‘He’s the next India captain after Rohit Sharma finishes': Darren Lehmann says Bumrah better than McGrath, Akram - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Darren Lehmann Praises Jasprit Bumrah as Future India Captain

Publication Date: Jan 01, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Darren Lehmann has expressed his admiration for Jasprit Bumrah, comparing him to legendary bowlers Akram and McGrath, and suggesting he could be India's next cricket captain post-Rohit Sharma.

  • Bumrah is currently the leading wicket-taker in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, with 30 wickets in the first 4 Tests.
  • Lehmann considers Bumrah the best bowler he has ever seen live.
  • He predicts Bumrah will succeed Rohit Sharma as captain of the Indian team.
  • Lehmann notes concerns about Australia's batting future but confidence in their bowling lineup.
“I have seen Wasim Akram, Glenn McGrath and all but I have not seen a bowler have impact like him in a single series like Jasprit Bumrah has.” - Darren Lehmann

Lehmann emphasizes that Bumrah's remarkable performance could reshape the Indian team dynamics and ensure a smooth transition in leadership.

item.title: ‘Everybody is afraid of Virat Kohli. That's why Dravid will be missed': Gambhir told to play Nitish Kumar Reddy at No.4 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Everybody is afraid of Virat Kohli. That's why Dravid will be missed': Gambhir told to play Nitish Kumar Reddy at No.4

Date: Jan 01, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former cricketer Basit Ali expressed concerns over Virat Kohli's performance and suggested changes to the Indian batting order ahead of the final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Kohli's recent Test scores have been disappointing, with only one decent performance in the recent series.
  • Gambhir is advised to move Kohli down to No. 5 and promote Nitish Kumar Reddy to No. 4.
  • Basit highlighted Kohli's struggles against off-stump deliveries and suggested the need for a strategic shift.
  • The former coach Rahul Dravid's absence is felt, as it could have made such adjustments easier.
“Perform nahi ho raha toh apna number toh neeche karo na. Rohit upar neeche kar raha hai, Virat ka koi nahi soch raha, kyunki darte hain na sab” - Basit Ali.

In conclusion, Gambhir's potential changes to the batting order may revitalize Kohli's form as India prepares for a critical match.

item.title: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli welcome 2025 in style: Spotted celebrating New Year in Sydney - WATCH - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli welcome 2025 in style: Spotted celebrating New Year in Sydney - WATCH

Date: January 1, 2025

Source: Times of India

Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were spotted celebrating the New Year in Sydney, showcasing their festive spirit and style.

  • High-profile couple Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli rang in the New Year in Sydney.
  • The celebration included festivities that captured their joyful moments together.
  • Fans were delighted to see their favorite couple celebrating in a vibrant city.
"We are excited to welcome the New Year with love and happiness!" - Anushka Sharma

This New Year’s celebration highlights the couple's enduring public presence and love for each other.

item.title: Carlsen, Nepomniachtchi Agree To Share World Blitz Title, Ju Wins Women's - Chess.com
item.description:
Carlsen, Nepomniachtchi Agree To Share World Blitz Title, Ju Wins Women's

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Chess.com

Grandmasters Magnus Carlsen and Ian Nepomniachtchi have agreed to share the title of 2024 FIDE World Blitz Chess Championship after a historic finals match, marking the first time that a chess world championship title has been shared. Ju Wenjun also celebrated victory in the Women's World Championship rematch.

  • Carlsen wins his eighth world blitz title.
  • Nepomniachtchi wins his first world blitz title.
  • Ju Wenjun defeats Lei Tingjie to become the Women's Blitz World Champion.
  • The championship concluded with a knockout format involving the top-eight finishers.
“Magnus Carlsen suggested to Ian Nepomniachtchi to share the first place!” — International Chess Federation.

This unique agreement between Carlsen and Nepomniachtchi showcases a rare moment in chess history, emphasizing collaboration over competition.
